name: Tab. Paracetamol 500mg
description: Analgesic and antipyretic commonly used for mild-to-moderate pain and fever; generally well tolerated, avoid overdose due to risk of liver injury.

name: Tab. Paracetamol 650mg
description: Higher single tablet strength of paracetamol used for pain/fever; same precautions regarding cumulative daily dose and hepatic risk.

name: Tab. Ibuprofen 400mg
description: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces pain, inflammation and fever; can cause gastric irritation, renal impairment, and increase bleeding risk.

name: Tab. Diclofenac 50mg
description: NSAID effective for inflammatory pain; caution with cardiovascular risk, GI side effects, and renal function.

name: Tab. Amoxicillin 500mg
description: A broad-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic used for many common bacterial infections; watch for allergy and GI side effects.

name: Tab. Amoxicillin + Clavulanic Acid 625mg
description: Beta-lactam plus beta-lactamase inhibitor extending spectrum to resistant organisms; increased GI side effects possible.

name: Tab. Azithromycin 500mg
description: Macrolide antibiotic with convenient short-course dosing and good tissue penetration; can affect cardiac rhythm (QT prolongation) in susceptible patients.

name: Tab. Ciprofloxacin 500mg
description: Fluoroquinolone antibiotic used for various infections; associated with tendon problems, CNS effects, and should be used when benefits outweigh risks.

name: Tab. Cefixime 200mg
description: Oral third-generation cephalosporin for community infections; generally well tolerated but avoid in severe penicillin allergy.

name: Tab. Metronidazole 400mg
description: Active against anaerobes and certain protozoa; avoid alcohol during and 48 hours after therapy due to disulfiram-like effects.

name: Tab. Cetirizine 10mg
description: Second-generation antihistamine used for allergic symptoms; less sedating than first-generation but may still cause drowsiness in some.

name: Tab. Levocetirizine 5mg
description: Active enantiomer of cetirizine with similar effects; used for allergic rhinitis and urticaria with low anticholinergic effects.

name: Tab. Montelukast 10mg
description: Leukotriene receptor antagonist used for asthma and allergic rhinitis; generally well tolerated but monitor for mood changes.

name: Tab. Montelukast + Levocetirizine
description: Combination therapy targeting different allergic pathways; useful in mixed allergic symptoms.

name: Tab. Omeprazole 20mg
description: Proton pump inhibitor that reduces gastric acid secretion; useful for reflux and peptic disease; long-term use associated with nutrient malabsorption and infection risk.

name: Tab. Pantoprazole 40mg
description: PPI similar to omeprazole with once-daily dosing for acid-related disorders; monitor for interaction with certain drugs long-term.

name: Tab. Ranitidine 150mg
description: H2 receptor antagonist historically used for acid suppression; note many formulations recalled in some regions—check local availability and advisories.

name: Tab. Domperidone 10mg
description: Peripheral dopamine antagonist used for nausea and gastroparesis; can prolong QT interval in high doses—use caution with cardiac disease.

name: Tab. Ondansetron 4mg
description: 5-HT3 antagonist effective for nausea and vomiting; may cause constipation and rare QT prolongation.

name: Tab. Loperamide 2mg
description: Opioid receptor agonist acting on gut to reduce diarrhea; avoids central effects at standard doses but misuse risk exists at very high doses.

name: ORS Sachet
description: Oral rehydration solution to replace fluids and electrolytes in dehydration; cornerstone of diarrheal management.

name: Tab. Metformin 500mg
description: First-line oral agent for type 2 diabetes that improves insulin sensitivity; gastrointestinal side effects common, rare risk of lactic acidosis in severe renal impairment.

name: Tab. Glimepiride 1mg
description: Sulfonylurea that increases insulin release; effective for glucose control but carries risk of hypoglycaemia and weight gain.

name: Tab. Amlodipine 5mg
description: Calcium channel blocker used for hypertension and angina; may cause peripheral edema and flushing.

name: Tab. Atenolol 50mg
description: Cardioselective beta-blocker for hypertension and ischemic heart disease; avoid abrupt withdrawal and use caution in asthma/COPD.

name: Tab. Telmisartan 40mg
description: Angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) used for hypertension with a favorable side-effect profile; avoid in pregnancy and monitor potassium/renal function.

name: Tab. Enalapril 5mg
description: ACE inhibitor reducing blood pressure and improving outcomes in heart failure; cough and hyperkalemia are notable adverse effects; contraindicated in pregnancy.

name: Tab. Atorvastatin 10mg
description: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor that lowers LDL cholesterol and reduces cardiovascular risk; monitor for muscle pain and liver enzymes.

name: Tab. Albendazole 400mg
description: Broad-spectrum antiparasitic used for intestinal worms and some tissue parasites; well tolerated but teratogenicity concerns in pregnancy for some indications.

name: Tab. Fluconazole 150mg
description: Systemic azole antifungal used for mucocutaneous fungal infections; can interact with many drugs via CYP metabolism.

name: Tab. Calcium + Vitamin D3
description: Supplement for bone health and prevention of deficiency; excessive calcium may cause constipation and, rarely, hypercalcemia.

name: Tab. B-Complex
description: Multivitamin complex providing B vitamins useful in deficiency states and some metabolic conditions; generally safe in recommended doses.

name: Tab. Iron + Folic Acid
description: Used to treat and prevent iron-deficiency anemia; may cause GI upset and dark stools; take on an empty stomach for best absorption but often advised with food for tolerance.

name: Syp. Paracetamol 125mg/5ml
description: Liquid formulation of paracetamol for children; dose by weight/age to avoid overdose—check dosing charts.

name: Syp. Amoxicillin 125mg/5ml
description: Paediatric oral amoxicillin suspension used for childhood infections; check reconstitution instructions and finish course.

name: Syp. Cough Mixture
description: Varied formulations exist; many are symptomatic and may contain expectorants, antihistamines or dextromethorphan—use based on symptoms and age limits.

name: Tab. Salbutamol 2mg
description: Short-acting beta2 agonist for relief of bronchospasm; inhaled formulations preferred for asthma to reduce systemic effects.

name: Tab. Prednisolone 5mg
description: Oral corticosteroid used for many inflammatory and allergic conditions; short courses are often safe, but long-term use has systemic side effects.

name: Tab. Dexamethasone 0.5mg
description: Potent corticosteroid with anti-inflammatory effects; used for a range of indications—monitor for systemic effects with prolonged therapy.

name: Cap. Doxycycline 100mg
description: Tetracycline antibiotic used for respiratory and skin infections and some atypical organisms; avoid in pregnancy and children under 8 due to teeth/bone effects, and avoid sun exposure.

name: Tab. Tinidazole 500mg
description: Similar to metronidazole with activity against protozoa and anaerobes; avoid alcohol during treatment.

name: Tab. Nitrofurantoin 100mg
description: Used for uncomplicated urinary tract infections; contraindicated in significant renal impairment and can cause pulmonary or hepatic adverse effects rarely.

name: Tab. Losartan 50mg
description: ARB for hypertension; generally well tolerated and useful in patients intolerant of ACE inhibitors.

name: Tab. Glibenclamide 5mg
description: Sulfonylurea with higher hypoglycaemia risk, especially in elderly; acts by stimulating insulin release.

name: Tab. Aspirin 75mg
description: Low-dose antiplatelet used for secondary prevention of cardiovascular events; increases bleeding risk and should be used with caution with other anticoagulants.

name: Tab. Clopidogrel 75mg
description: P2Y12 receptor inhibitor used to reduce arterial thrombosis risk; monitor for bleeding and consider interaction with some PPIs.

name: Tab. Furosemide 40mg
description: Loop diuretic used for fluid overload and oedema; causes electrolyte disturbances and requires monitoring of renal function and potassium.

name: Tab. Spironolactone 25mg
description: Aldosterone antagonist useful in heart failure and resistant hypertension; can cause hyperkalemia and endocrine side effects (gynecomastia).

name: Tab. Chloroquine 250mg
description: Historically used antimalarial; resistance is common in many regions—use based on local guidelines.

name: Tab. Artemether + Lumefantrine
description: Artemisinin-based combination therapy for uncomplicated falciparum malaria; must adhere to full course and take with fat for absorption.

name: Tab. Phenytoin 100mg
description: Sodium-channel blocker anticonvulsant with nonlinear kinetics: therapeutic drug monitoring often required; can cause gum hypertrophy and drug interactions.

name: Tab. Carbamazepine 200mg
description: Sodium-channel blocker effective in focal seizures and trigeminal neuralgia; induces hepatic enzymes and has hematologic and dermatologic adverse effects.

name: Tab. Sodium Valproate 200mg
description: Broad-spectrum anticonvulsant effective for generalized and focal seizures; teratogenic and associated with weight gain and hepatic effects—monitor liver function.

name: Tab. Amitriptyline 10mg
description: Tricyclic antidepressant used for depression and neuropathic pain; anticholinergic side effects and cardiac conduction effects limit use in some patients.

name: Tab. Fluoxetine 20mg
description: SSRI antidepressant with long half-life used in depression and anxiety disorders; may cause GI upset and sexual dysfunction; gradual onset of effect.

name: Tab. Diazepam 5mg
description: Benzodiazepine for anxiety and insomnia with sedative and muscle-relaxant effects; risk of dependence with prolonged use and respiratory depression with other CNS depressants.

name: Tab. Haloperidol 1.5mg
description: Typical antipsychotic effective for psychosis; can cause extrapyramidal side effects and requires monitoring.

name: Tab. Levodopa + Carbidopa
description: Gold-standard symptomatic therapy for Parkinson's disease; long-term motor complications can occur and dosing is individualized.

name: Tab. Digoxin 0.25mg
description: Inotropic agent used in heart failure and some arrhythmias; narrow therapeutic window—monitor levels and interactions.

name: Tab. Warfarin 5mg
description: Vitamin K antagonist requiring INR monitoring for therapeutic effect; many drug and dietary interactions and contraindicated in pregnancy except rare cases.

name: Tab. Thyroxine 50mcg
description: Replacement therapy for hypothyroidism; dose titrated by TSH levels; take on empty stomach for consistent absorption.

name: Tab. Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg
description: Thiazide diuretic used in hypertension; may cause electrolyte changes (low K+, Na+) and metabolic effects.

name: Tab. Bisoprolol 5mg
description: Cardioselective beta-blocker for hypertension and heart disease; monitor for bradycardia and avoid abrupt cessation.

name: Tab. Rosuvastatin 10mg
description: Potent statin that lowers LDL cholesterol; monitor for myopathy and liver enzymes.

name: Tab. Sitagliptin 100mg
description: DPP-4 inhibitor that increases incretin hormones to improve glycaemic control; generally well tolerated with low hypoglycaemia risk.

name: Tab. Vildagliptin 50mg
description: DPP-4 inhibitor similar to sitagliptin; used for type 2 diabetes to improve glycaemic control.

name: Tab. Gliclazide 60mg MR
description: Modified-release sulfonylurea used once daily for glycemic control; monitor for hypoglycaemia.

name: Tab. Pioglitazone 15mg
description: Thiazolidinedione improving insulin sensitivity; associated with weight gain, fluid retention, and risk of heart failure in predisposed patients.

name: Tab. Allopurinol 100mg
description: Xanthine oxidase inhibitor to lower uric acid levels; start low and monitor for hypersensitivity—dose adjustment needed in renal impairment.

name: Tab. Methotrexate 7.5mg
description: Disease-modifying antirheumatic drug used in rheumatologic conditions and some cancers; folic acid supplementation recommended and monitor blood counts/liver function.

name: Tab. Hydroxychloroquine 200mg
description: Used in autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis and lupus; eye toxicity is rare but requires periodic ophthalmologic monitoring.

name: Tab. Azathioprine 50mg
description: Immunosuppressant used in autoimmune disease and transplant; monitor blood counts and liver function, and consider TPMT testing.

name: Tab. Sulfasalazine 500mg
description: Used in inflammatory bowel disease and rheumatologic conditions; can cause GI upset and hypersensitivity reactions.

name: Tab. Mycophenolate Mofetil 500mg
description: Antiproliferative agent used in transplant and autoimmune disease; associated with cytopenias and gastrointestinal side effects.

name: Tab. Ciclosporin 100mg
description: Calcineurin inhibitor with narrow therapeutic index used in transplantation and autoimmune disease; nephrotoxicity and drug interactions are important considerations.

name: Tab. Rifampicin 600mg
description: Key antitubercular agent that induces hepatic enzymes and colors body fluids orange; interactions with many drugs and must be used as part of combination therapy.

name: Tab. Isoniazid 300mg
description: First-line antitubercular with risk of hepatotoxicity and peripheral neuropathy (give pyridoxine to reduce neuropathy risk).

name: Tab. Pyrazinamide 1500mg
description: Part of initial TB regimen; can cause hyperuricemia and hepatotoxicity—monitoring recommended.

name: Tab. Ethambutol 800mg
description: Active against mycobacteria; optic neuritis is a key adverse effect—monitor vision during therapy.

name: Tab. Oseltamivir 75mg
description: Neuraminidase inhibitor for influenza; most effective when started early and may reduce symptom duration.

name: Tab. Acyclovir 400mg
description: Antiviral for herpesvirus infections; dosing and duration vary by indication—adequate hydration helps renal clearance.

name: Tab. Tenofovir 300mg
description: Nucleotide reverse-transcriptase inhibitor used in HIV and hepatitis B; monitor renal function and bone density with long-term use.

name: Tab. Entecavir 0.5mg
description: Nucleoside analogue used for hepatitis B with good potency and tolerability; adherence is important to prevent resistance.

name: Tab. Sofosbuvir 400mg
description: Direct-acting antiviral for hepatitis C with high cure rates in combination regimens; regimen choice depends on genotype and liver status.

name: Tab. Daclatasvir 60mg
description: NS5A inhibitor used as part of combination therapy for hepatitis C; drug interactions possible via CYP enzymes.

name: Inj. Insulin Glargine 10U
description: Long-acting basal insulin for diabetes management; adjust dose according to glucose monitoring to avoid hypoglycemia.

name: Inj. Insulin Mixtard 10U
description: Premixed insulin providing basal and prandial coverage; dosing individualized and risk of hypoglycemia exists.

name: Tab. Propranolol 20mg
description: Non-selective beta-blocker used for migraine prophylaxis, essential tremor and cardiac indications; caution in asthma and peripheral vascular disease.

name: Tab. Clonazepam 0.5mg
description: Benzodiazepine with anticonvulsant and anxiolytic properties; risk of dependence and daytime sedation.

name: Tab. Lorazepam 1mg
description: Intermediate-acting benzodiazepine used for anxiety and acute agitation; monitor for sedation and dependence.

name: Tab. Zolpidem 10mg
description: Non-benzodiazepine hypnotic for short-term insomnia; caution with next-day impairment and complex sleep-related behaviors.

name: Tab. Escitalopram 10mg
description: SSRI used for depression and anxiety; may take weeks for effect and has typical SSRI side effects.

name: Tab. Sertraline 50mg
description: SSRI for depression and anxiety disorders; consider interactions and gradual dose titration.

name: Tab. Venlafaxine 75mg
description: SNRI effective in depression and some anxiety disorders; monitor blood pressure at higher doses.

name: Tab. Quetiapine 25mg
description: Atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder; metabolic side effects (weight, lipids, glucose) are considerations.

name: Tab. Olanzapine 5mg
description: Effective antipsychotic with higher risk of metabolic adverse effects; monitor weight and metabolic parameters.

name: Tab. Risperidone 2mg
description: Atypical antipsychotic used for psychosis and mood disorders; can raise prolactin and cause extrapyramidal symptoms.

name: Tab. Donepezil 5mg
description: Cholinesterase inhibitor used in Alzheimer's disease to improve cognitive symptoms modestly; may cause GI and sleep disturbances.

name: Tab. Memantine 10mg
description: NMDA receptor antagonist used for moderate-severe Alzheimer's disease; generally well tolerated.

name: Tab. Calcium Carbonate 500mg
description: Oral calcium supplement for deficiency and bone health; separate from some medications to avoid absorption interactions.

name: Cap. Vitamin D3 60k
description: High-dose vitamin D given intermittently to correct deficiency; monitoring and maintenance dosing follow correction.

name: Tab. Vitamin C 500mg
description: Antioxidant vitamin used to prevent/treat deficiency and support wound healing; excess may cause GI upset or kidney stones in predisposed individuals.

name: Tab. Zinc Sulphate 20mg
description: Used in acute diarrhoea in children and for deficiency; high doses can cause nausea and interfere with copper absorption.

name: Tab. Mupirocin 2% Ointment
description: Topical antibiotic for superficial skin infections (e.g., impetigo); limited systemic absorption.

name: Tab. Clotrimazole 1% Cream
description: Azole antifungal for superficial fungal infections of skin and mucosa; generally well tolerated locally.

name: Tab. Hydrocortisone 1% Cream
description: Mild topical corticosteroid for inflammatory dermatoses; avoid prolonged use on thin skin or large areas.

name: Tab. Silver Sulfadiazine 1% Cream
description: Topical agent for burn wound infection prevention; systemic sulfonamide effects are rare but possible.

name: Tab. Moxifloxacin Eye Drops 0.5%
description: Broad-spectrum ophthalmic fluoroquinolone for bacterial eye infections; avoid prolonged indiscriminate use to limit resistance.

name: Tab. Timolol Eye Drops 0.5%
description: Topical beta-blocker for glaucoma to lower intraocular pressure; systemic absorption may affect heart and lungs.

name: Tab. Latanoprost Eye Drops 0.005%
description: Prostaglandin analogue used once nightly to reduce intraocular pressure; may change eyelash growth and iris pigmentation.

name: Tab. Mometasone Nasal Spray 50mcg
description: Intranasal steroid for allergic rhinitis with good local efficacy and low systemic absorption at recommended doses.

name: Tab. Salmeterol + Fluticasone Inhaler
description: Combination LABA and inhaled steroid for asthma/COPD control; regular use indicated for persistent symptoms—use spacer for inhaler technique if needed.

name: Tab. Budesonide Inhaler 200mcg
description: Inhaled steroid reducing airway inflammation in asthma; rinse mouth after use to lower thrush risk.

name: Tab. Tiotropium Inhaler 18mcg
description: Long-acting muscarinic antagonist for COPD maintenance with bronchodilator effect and convenient once-daily dosing.

name: Tab. Ipratropium Bromide Nasal Spray
description: Used for rhinorrhoea in nonallergic and vasomotor rhinitis; local anticholinergic effects predominate.

name: Tab. Salbutamol Inhaler 100mcg
description: Short-acting reliever inhaler for acute bronchospasm—teach correct inhaler technique and keep accessible.

name: Tab. Epinephrine Auto-injector 0.3mg
description: Rapid-acting adrenergic agonist for anaphylaxis; intramuscular administration is life-saving—seek emergency care after use.

name: Tab. Tramadol 50mg
description: Moderate opioid analgesic with serotonergic effects; risk of dependence and seizures at high doses; interact with other CNS depressants.

name: Tab. Codeine + Paracetamol 30/500mg
description: Combination opioid for moderate pain; codeine metabolized variably—use cautiously in children and those with respiratory disease.

name: Tab. Naloxone Injection 0.4mg/ml
description: Opioid antagonist for suspected opioid overdose to reverse respiratory depression—requires monitoring and possible repeat dosing.

name: Tab. Enoxaparin 40mg/0.4ml
description: Anticoagulant used for thromboprophylaxis and acute VTE treatment; dosing adjusted for weight and renal function—monitor for bleeding.

name: Tab. Apixaban 2.5mg
description: Direct factor Xa inhibitor used for stroke prevention in AF and VTE; no routine monitoring but consider renal function and bleeding risk.

name: Tab. Rivaroxaban 10mg
description: Oral factor Xa inhibitor for VTE prophylaxis and treatment; adhere to dosing schedule and assess renal function.

name: Tab. Meropenem 1g
description: Broad-spectrum IV antibiotic reserved for severe or resistant infections; use guided by microbiology to limit resistance emergence.

name: Tab. Piperacillin + Tazobactam 4.5g
description: Broad-spectrum beta-lactam/beta-lactamase inhibitor for severe infections including Pseudomonas coverage; usually inpatient IV therapy.

name: Tab. Clarithromycin 500mg
description: Macrolide antibiotic similar to azithromycin with interaction potential via CYP3A4—use caution with other medications.

name: Tab. Cefuroxime 500mg
description: Second-generation cephalosporin for respiratory and some soft tissue infections; check for penicillin allergy cross-reactivity.

name: Tab. Linezolid 600mg
description: Active against resistant Gram-positive organisms including MRSA and VRE; long courses may cause myelosuppression and neuropathy, and interact with serotonergic drugs.

name: Tab. Vancomycin 1g
description: IV agent for serious Gram-positive infections; therapeutic drug monitoring often required to optimize efficacy and minimize toxicity.

name: Tab. Metformin SR 500mg
description: Sustained-release formulation of metformin to reduce GI side effects while maintaining glycemic benefits.

name: Tab. Empagliflozin 10mg
description: SGLT2 inhibitor lowering glucose via renal excretion; benefits on heart failure and renal outcomes in some patients but risk of genital infections and euglycemic ketoacidosis in certain settings.

name: Tab. Dapagliflozin 10mg
description: SGLT2 inhibitor used in diabetes and heart failure settings; monitor renal function and educate on genital hygiene to reduce infections.

name: Tab. Liraglutide 0.6mg
description: GLP-1 receptor agonist improving glycemic control and often reducing weight; injection therapy with GI side effects common initially.

name: Tab. Semaglutide 0.25mg
description: Long-acting GLP-1 receptor agonist administered weekly for diabetes and some indications for weight management; monitor for GI adverse effects.

name: Tab. Omeprazole IV 40mg
description: IV PPI used when oral route unavailable for acid suppression—used in GI bleeding or perioperative settings.

name: Tab. Azathioprine (additional) 50mg
description: Used in autoimmune conditions; metabolized variably—consider testing for TPMT activity to reduce hematologic toxicity risk.

name: Tab. Mycophenolate Sodium 500mg
description: Alternative formulation of mycophenolate with similar immunosuppressive effects and monitoring needs.

name: Tab. Prednisone 5mg
description: Oral glucocorticoid used widely for inflammatory conditions with dose and duration determining adverse effect profile—taper when stopping prolonged therapy.

name: Tab. Benzoyl Peroxide 5% Gel
description: Topical agent for acne with antibacterial and keratolytic properties; may cause local irritation and bleaching of fabrics.

name: Tab. Isotretinoin 10mg
description: Powerful systemic acne therapy with teratogenicity risks and multiple monitoring requirements; reserved for severe nodulocystic acne under specialist supervision.

name: Tab. Sildenafil 50mg
description: PDE5 inhibitor for erectile dysfunction; contraindicated with nitrates and caution with cardiovascular disease.

name: Tab. Tamsulosin 0.4mg
description: Alpha-1 blocker used to improve urinary flow in benign prostatic hyperplasia; may cause postural hypotension and ejaculatory disturbance.

name: Tab. Finasteride 5mg
description: 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that reduces prostate volume and male-pattern hair loss; sexual adverse effects and teratogenic—avoid in women of childbearing potential.

name: Tab. Omalizumab 150-300mg
description: Monoclonal antibody for severe allergic asthma and chronic urticaria; administered by specialist with monitoring for injection reactions.

name: Tab. Denosumab 60mg
description: RANKL inhibitor used to reduce fracture risk in osteoporosis; dental evaluation advised before starting due to osteonecrosis risk.

name: Tab. Levothyroxine (additional) 100mcg
description: Standard replacement dose in hypothyroidism—dose individualized to TSH and clinical response.
